story.name: 3df0b653-21e1-4cf5-a49e-a33217d88d9d
story.title: Santander to Take $1.7 Billion Charge Tied to U.K. Operations
story.summary: PYCQI6T0AFB4(Bloomberg) -- Banco Santander SA, the euro zone’s biggest bank by market value, said it would take a 1.5 billion-euro ($1.7 billion) goodwill impairment as Brexit and a “challenging regulatory environment” squeeze profits at its U.K. business.The impairment will be included in third-quarter results, the Spanish lender said in a regulatory filing on Tuesday. It won’t affect common equity Tier 1 capital. The bank also announced a dividend payment of 10 euro cents a share.Santander...

xmlText.p: (Bloomberg) -- Banco Santander SA, the euro zone’s biggest bank by market value, said it would take a 1.5 billion-euro ($1.7 billion) goodwill impairment as Brexit and a “challenging regulatory environment” squeeze profits at its U.K. business.

The impairment will be included in third-quarter results, the Spanish lender said in a regulatory filing on Tuesday. It won’t affect common equity Tier 1 capital. The bank also announced a dividend payment of 10 euro cents a share.

Santander UK, the lender’s fourth-largest unit, has struggled amid increased competition in the mortgage market, heavy regulation and Brexit uncertainty. Profit at the unit fell 13% in the second quarter from a year earlier on reduced income from lending and fees.

The bank also suffered losses on refunds to customers who were given inaccurate information when sold payment-protection insurance. It reported a second-quarter charge of 108 million euros, in part from costs related to the shuttering of 140 U.K. branches.
Santander in 2017 took a 600-million euro charge to reflect lower earnings at Santander Consumer USA Holdings Inc, its unit focused on subprime auto loans.

The Spanish lender entered the U.K. market with the acquisition of building society Abbey National in 2004. It expanded with the purchases of Bradford & Bingley and Alliance & Leicester in 2008 and 2009 and rebranded in 2010 as Santander UK.
To contact the reporter on this story: Charlie Devereux in Madrid at cdevereux3@bloomberg.net
To contact the editors responsible for this story: Dale Crofts at dcrofts@bloomberg.net, Dan Reichl, Steve Dickson
For more articles like this, please visit us at bloomberg.com
